1947 NCAA I
Baseball Tournament
Season 1947
Teams 8
Finals Site
  • Hyames Field
  • Kalamazoo, MI
Champions California (1st title)
Runner-Up Yale (1st CWS Appearance)
Winning coach Clint Evans (1st title)
  • NCAA Division I Baseball Championship
  • 1948 →

The 1947 NCAA Baseball Tournament was the first NCAA-sanctioned baseball tournament that determined a national champion. The tournament was held as the conclusion of the 1947 NCAA baseball season, beginning on June 20.[1] The 1947 College World Series was played at Hyames Field on the campus of Western Michigan University in Kalamazoo, Michigan from June 27 to June 28. The first tournament's champion was California, coached by Clint Evans.

Contents

  • 1 Tournament
    • 1.1 Field

Tournament[edit]

The tournament was divided into two regional brackets, the Eastern Playoff and the Western Playoff. Each region played a single elimination bracket, with the champion advancing to the College World Series.

Field[edit]

The tournament field was determined by regional committees, some of whom held playoffs, while others selected specific conference champions, and still others simply selected their representatives. The eight teams were divided among the East and West brackets.[2]

School Conference Record (Conference) Berth Last NCAA Appearance
California CIBA 27–10 (11–4) None
Clemson Southern 24–4 (13–2) Won Southern District Playoff None
Denver None
Illinois Big Nine 22–5 (9–3) None
NYU MNYC None
Oklahoma Big Six Won District Playoff None
Texas SWC 18–1 None
Yale EIBL 19–6 (9–3) District selection None

Eastern Playoff[edit]

At Yale Field, New Haven, Connecticut[3][4][1]

Semifinals Finals
      
1 Yale 7
4 Clemson 3
Yale 6
NYU 4
3 NYU 2
2 Illinois 1

Western Playoff[edit]

At Denver, Colorado[5][6]

Semifinals Finals
      
1 California 3
4 Denver 1
California 8
Texas 7
3 Texas 10
2 Oklahoma 9

College World Series[edit]

(last: none)		 none 0–0

(last: none)		 none 0–0

Results[edit]

The first College World Series was a best of three series.

Bracket[edit]

  College World Series Finals
           
   California 17 8 –
   Yale 4 7 –

Game results[edit]

Date Game Winner Score Loser Notes
June 27 Game 1 California 17–4 Yale
June 28 Game 2 California 8–7 Yale California wins CWS

Notable players[edit]

  • California: Jackie Jensen
  • Yale: Frank Quinn, George Bush, Bill Howe

Tournament notes[edit]

Future President of the United States George Bush was Yale's captain and appeared in the 1947 and 1948 College World Series. (Bush was actually waiting on-deck when Cal recorded the final out in the second game of the 1947 series.)[citation needed]

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b Joel Alderman (July 7, 2017). "The inaugural game in an NCAA Baseball Tournament took place at Yale Field in 1947, when Clemson opposed Yale and future U.S. President George H. W. Bush". WTNH SportzEdge. Retrieved July 8, 2017. 
  2. ^ Woody Anderson (May 31, 1996). "At The Inaugural Series, A President In The Lineup". Hartford Courant. Retrieved 2012-07-11. 
  3. ^ 2011 Clemson Baseball Media Guide. Clemson University. p. 137. Retrieved 2012-07-11. 
  4. ^ 2012 Record Book (PDF). Illinois University. p. 79. Retrieved 2012-07-11. 
  5. ^ 2011 Golden Bears Record Book. University of California. p. 17. Retrieved 2012-07-11. 
  6. ^ 2011 Fact Book (PDF). University of Texas. p. 76. Retrieved 2012-07-11.
